event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: There is a failure with a FRU presence signal or I/O boat location signal in an External I/O Expansion Unit.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
One of the presence signals has failed. Signals for this diagnosis are comprised of both presence signals and also FRU location signals. These signals span multiple FRUs. A failed PSU presence signals will result in the chassis appearing to be a single PSU system. The green LED's in the PSU will be on but the others will remain off. The fans will remain at high speed in both PSU's.

If a FRU was recently replaced, this fault is likely due to a bent pin. If the system has been running before this message appeared then fault may have occurred in the ASIC which accepts the signal. If a bent pin is seen via inspection, note the FRU containing it and report it along with the other information gathered below.

Follow the steps below to obtain the necessary data for presentation to your authorized service provider.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

XSCF> fmdump -m
MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8000-35, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 05:50:22 PDT 2007
PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
EVENT-ID: 383a648e-f537-4426-8058-c8f735007b23
DESC: There is a failure with a FRU presence signal
or I/O boat location signal in an External I/O Expansion Unit.
Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/IOXSCF-8000-35 for more information.
AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken
IMPACT: Hardware may not be monitored by the system.
REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.

Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -v -u 383a648e-f537-4426-8058-c8f735007b23
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 05:50:22.7316 383a648e-f537-4426-8058-c8f735007b23 IOXSCF-8000-35
          50% fault.chassis.iox.device.signal
          Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/iob=0/pres_sig=0
             Affects: -
                 FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=XE008L:part=5016939:revision=04/component=IOX@X031/IOB0
          50% fault.chassis.iox.device.signal
          Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/boat_pres=0
             Affects: -
                 FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=XCX031:part=5016937:revision=03/component=IOX@X031

Step 3: Provide the output collected to your service provider.
The information collected above will help your service provider to schedule a repair at your convenience.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Hardware may not be monitored by the system.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: External I/O Expansion Unit signal failure
